text: Is there a production ready web application framework in Python?
I heard lots of good opinions about Python language.
They say it's mature, expressive etc...
I'm looking for production-ready enterprise application frameworks in Python.

lis.text: supports objective-relational mapping with caching and declarative desciption (like JPA, Hibernate etc..)
controls oriented user interface support - no HTML templates but something like JSF (RichFaces, Icefaces) or GWT, Vaadin, ZK
component decomposition and dependency injection (like EJB or Spring)
clustering, modularity etc (like Terracota, OSGi etc..)
there are successful applications written in it by companies like IBM, Oracle etc (I mean real business applications not Twitter)

text: Is it possible at all in Python world ?

lis.text: use Python and write everything from the bottom (too expensice)
